block.p: AN extensive electronic reference library for children -- about a billion words of resource information drawn from sources ranging from The Jerusalem Post to Shakespeare -- is now available on Prodigy. Called Homework Helper, it was developed by Marvin Weinberger, an electronic-information consultant, and his wife, Fran, a teacher, through their company, Infonautics, in Wayne, Pa. Homework Helper, which is reached through the command "Jump Homework" when connected to Prodigy, offers access to newspapers, magazines, newswire services, radio and television transcripts, encyclopedias, almanacs, classic literature texts, the Bible, photographs and maps.

AN extensive electronic reference library for children -- about a billion words of resource information drawn from sources ranging from The Jerusalem Post to Shakespeare -- is now available on Prodigy. Called Homework Helper, it was developed by Marvin Weinberger, an electronic-information consultant, and his wife, Fran, a teacher, through their company, Infonautics, in Wayne, Pa. Homework Helper, which is reached through the command "Jump Homework" when connected to Prodigy, offers access to newspapers, magazines, newswire services, radio and television transcripts, encyclopedias, almanacs, classic literature texts, the Bible, photographs and maps.

Subscribers pay $9.95 a month plus Prodigy's communications rate of $2.95 an hour. Information: (800) 776-3449, option 1. Homework Helper will be available on the Internet's World Wide Web this fall. DULCIE LEIMBACH
